questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 42 cm and a width of 28 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = length × width = 42 × 28 = 1176 cm²

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 96 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 96 ÷ 4 = 24 cm. Area = side² = 24 × 24 = 576 cm²

questions.question: A circle has a diameter of 32 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Radius = diameter ÷ 2 = 32 ÷ 2 = 16 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 16 × 16 = 804 cm²

questions.question: The area of a regular hexagon is 324√3 square centimeters. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: Area of regular hexagon = (3√3/2) × side². Therefore, side² = (2 × 324√3) ÷ (3√3) = 144. Therefore, side = √144 = 12 cm

questions.question: A triangle has a base of 30 cm and a height of 22 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 30 × 22 = 330 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 480 square meters and its width is 20 meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 480 ÷ 20 = 24 meters. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(24 + 20) = 88 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 24 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × (22/7) × 24 = 150 cm

questions.question: The area of a parallelogram is 240 square centimeters and its base is 30 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Height = area ÷ base = 240 ÷ 30 = 8 cm

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have the same area. The rectangle has length 54 cm and width 24 cm. What is the perimeter of the square?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = 54 × 24 = 1296 cm². Side of square = √1296 = 36 cm. Perimeter of square = 4 × 36 = 144 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 360 square meters. Its parallel sides are 40 meters and 80 meters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 360) ÷ (40 + 80) = 720 ÷ 120 = 6 meters

questions.question: A regular pentagon has a side length of 18 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: In a regular pentagon, all sides are equal. Perimeter = 5 × side length = 5 × 18 = 90 cm

questions.question: The area of a circle is 804 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 804. Therefore, r² = 804 ÷ (22/7) = 256. Therefore, r = √256 = 16 cm

questions.question: A rectangle has a perimeter of 84 cm and a length of 28 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(length + width). Therefore, width = (84 ÷ 2) - 28 = 14 cm. Area = length × width = 28 × 14 = 392 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rhombus is 240 square centimeters and one of its diagonals is 40 centimeters. What is the length of the other diagonal?
questions.explanation: Area of rhombus = (1/2) × product of diagonals. Therefore, other diagonal = (2 × area) ÷ given diagonal = (2 × 240) ÷ 40 = 12 cm

questions.question: A circle has a circumference of 150 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 150. Therefore, r = 150 ÷ (2 × 22/7) = 23.86 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 23.86 × 23.86 = 1786 cm²

questions.question: The perimeter of a rectangle is 72 cm and its area is 320 square centimeters. What are its dimensions?
questions.explanation: Let length = l and width = w. Then 2(l + w) = 72 and l × w = 320. Solving these equations gives l = 20 cm and w = 16 cm

questions.question: A regular octagon has a side length of 14 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: In a regular octagon, all sides are equal. Perimeter = 8 × side length = 8 × 14 = 112 cm

questions.question: The area of a triangle is 150 square centimeters and its height is 20 centimeters. What is its base?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height. Therefore, base = (2 × area) ÷ height = (2 × 150) ÷ 20 = 15 cm

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have the same perimeter. The rectangle has length 42 cm and width 30 cm. What is the area of the square?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(42 + 30) = 144 cm. Side of square = 144 ÷ 4 = 36 cm. Area of square = 36 × 36 = 1296 cm²

questions.question: The area of a circle is 962.5 square centimeters. What is its diameter? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 962.5. Therefore, r² = 962.5 ÷ 3.14 = 306.53. Therefore, r = √306.53 = 17.5 cm. Diameter = 2 × r = 2 × 17.5 = 35 cm

questions.question: A parallelogram has a base of 36 cm and a height of 16 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of parallelogram = base × height = 36 × 16 = 576 cm²

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 188.4 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 188.4. Therefore, r = 188.4 ÷ (2 × 3.14) = 30 cm. Area = πr² = 3.14 × 30 × 30 = 2826 cm²

questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 45 cm and an area of 405 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 405 ÷ 45 = 9 cm. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(45 + 9) = 108 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 100 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 100 ÷ 4 = 25 cm. Area = side² = 25 × 25 = 625 cm²

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 35 cm, 120 cm, and 125 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (35-120-125). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 35 × 120 = 2100 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 540 square meters and its width is 20 meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 540 ÷ 20 = 27 meters. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(27 + 20) = 94 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 28 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × 3.14 × 28 = 176 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 420 square centimeters. Its parallel sides are 50 centimeters and 70 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 420) ÷ (50 + 70) = 840 ÷ 120 = 7 cm

questions.question: A square has an area of 961 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Side length = √961 = 31 cm. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 31 = 124 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 219.8 cm. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 219.8. Therefore, r = 219.8 ÷ (2 × 3.14) = 35 cm
